chargeHist.descr: Capture an Intimate Representation  (Victim < 18 years old)
Sexual Intercourse with Child 16 or Older, Actor 19 or Older

result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Allen Pollock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Capture an Intimate Representation (Victim < 18 years old), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Any treatment/counseling as deemed necessary 
Register as sex offender for 15 years

records.addlTxt: 9:13 AM Defendant Matthew Allen Pollock in court.  Attorney Justin W. Henry in court for Matthew Allen Pollock.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander David Goulart in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to count 1. Court finds defendant guilty. Count 2 dismissed and read in. Defendant waives his right to presentence investigation. Court orders 3 years probation, any treatment deemed necessary, cost due within 60 days, must register as sex offender for 15 years. Sentence credit 0 days.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

8:46 AM Defendant Matthew Allen Pollock in court by phone with attorney Justin W. Henry by video. Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily. Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Bond to continue.
Preliminary hearing on May 17, 2022 at 08:45 am.
